p: First, programmed checks only for severe and poorly controlled allergic disease were carried out on outpatients, who were instructed to come at a set time and to maintain social distancing. To reduce the risk of in-hospital spread of the infection, COVID-19 and COVID-19–free zones were created. Checkpoints were created at the COVID-19–free-zone entrance to detect patients with fever (>37.5°C) and to screen for symptoms of active infection and/or contact with COVID-19–positive individuals. When the risk was considered low, patients were provided with protective surgical masks and sanitized to access the hospital.
